discoveredAssets: localhost:8080 - Trading Platform web application (Apache/2.4.65, Python/Flask) - Port 8080, active
/ - Login endpoint (POST for username submission) - Port 80
/password/{username} - Two-step authentication endpoint with user enumeration - Port 8080
/dashboard - Authenticated user dashboard - Port 8080, requires session
Test user account (test:test, user_id: 10032) - Hardcoded in application HTML comments

targets.objective: Test authentication bypass vulnerabilities including SQL injection in username field, test known default credentials, verify proper input validation and error handling
targets.rationale: Login page is primary entry point. Known test credentials (test:test) available. Input validation weakness indicated by user enumeration vulnerability observed.

targets.objective: Test for IDOR vulnerability by attempting to modify user_id parameter, test for SQL injection in both username and password fields, verify rate limiting and brute force protections, enumerate valid users
targets.rationale: CRITICAL: User ID exposed as hidden form field with client-side ID injection vulnerability. No apparent server-side validation on user_id parameter. User enumeration confirmed - different responses for existing vs non-existing users. Endpoints accepts user_id as POST parameter which could be modified for privilege escalation.

targets.objective: Test for session management vulnerabilities, CSRF attacks on logout function, information disclosure in authenticated context, test for horizontal privilege escalation by modifying session cookies
targets.rationale: Authenticated endpoint with session cookie. May expose user-specific data or functionality. POST logout endpoint without CSRF protection indicated by absence of CSRF tokens in HTML.

targets.objective: Authenticate as test user to access dashboard, explore authenticated functionality, test for privilege escalation within user context, verify session handling
targets.rationale: Known working credentials for account with user_id 10032. Allows accessing authenticated features to identify additional vulnerabilities in the application logic.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Test account hardcoded in application - credentials (test:test) exposed in HTML comments with TODO reminder to delete. User ID: 10032
[CRITICAL] User ID parameter exposed as hidden form field in /password/{username} endpoint - potential IDOR vulnerability allowing unauthorized access to other user accounts
[HIGH] User enumeration vulnerability at /password/{username} - application reveals whether username exists through different HTTP responses
[HIGH] No rate limiting observed on /password/{username} endpoint - enables brute force attacks on user credentials
[HIGH] Application uses custom two-step authentication flow that may bypass standard session security practices
[MEDIUM] Static file assets served from /static/ directory - CSS framework version exposed
[MEDIUM] No CSRF tokens visible in forms - potential CSRF vulnerability on logout and other POST endpoints
[LOW] Application is web-based trading platform with sensitive financial transactions - requires comprehensive security testing
